intro.description:
Contents
This tutorial demonstrates how to edit and run scripts in Bioclipse.

item.title: Step 1: Open an existing script
item.description:
Note: You need Sample Data installed to complete this step.
In the navigator, expand the Sample Data project, navigate to the folder JavaScript scripts and double-click on the file extractsmilesAndMass.js. This opens the file in an editor.

item.title: Step 2: Run the active script
item.description: To run the script, press the Run button in the toolbar. Note that the editor must be active for this to work; if the button is greyed out you can enable it by clicking in the editor.

item.title: Step 3: View Gist for Bioclipse
item.description: Gists are versioned scripts available from http://gist.github.com. You can find scripts for Bioclipse on Delicious, http://delicious.com/tag/bioclipse+gist.

item.title: Step 4: Download Gists into Bioclipse
item.description:
Bioclipse has Gist support built-in. use the command:
gist.download(95755)
The result in the JavaScript console tells you the name of the downloaded file.
